manify.utils.benchmarks

Implementation for benchmarking different product space machine learning methods

Functions

benchmark(X, y, pm[, device, score, models, ...])

Benchmarks various machine learning models on a dataset using a product manifold structure.
manify.utils.benchmarks.benchmark(X, y, pm, device='cpu', score=['accuracy', 'f1-micro', 'f1-macro'], models=['sklearn_dt', 'sklearn_rf', 'product_dt', 'product_rf', 'tangent_dt', 'tangent_rf', 'knn', 'ps_perceptron', 'ambient_mlp', 'tangent_gcn', 'ambient_gcn', 'kappa_gcn', 'ambient_mlr', 'tangent_mlr', 'kappa_mlr', 'single_manifold_rf'], max_depth=5, n_estimators=12, min_samples_split=2, min_samples_leaf=1, task='classification', seed=None, use_special_dims=False, n_features='d_choose_2', X_train=None, X_test=None, y_train=None, y_test=None, batch_size=None, adj=None, A_train=None, A_test=None, hidden_dims=[32, 32], epochs=4000, lr=0.0001, kappa_gcn_layers=1, lp_train_idx=None, lp_test_idx=None)

Benchmarks various machine learning models on a dataset using a product manifold structure.

Parameters:

  • X (batch, dim) – Input tensor of features

  • y (batch,) – Input tensor of labels.

  • pm (ProductManifold) – The defined product manifold for benchmarks.

  • split – Data splitting strategy (‘train_test’ or ‘cross_val’).

  • device (Literal['cpu', 'cuda', 'mps']) – Device for computation (‘cpu’, ‘cuda’, ‘mps’).

  • score (List[Literal['accuracy', 'f1-micro', 'f1-macro', 'mse', 'percent_rmse', 'time']]) – Scoring metric for model evaluation (‘accuracy’, ‘f1-micro’, etc.).

  • models (List[Literal['sklearn_dt', 'sklearn_rf', 'product_dt', 'product_rf', 'tangent_dt', 'tangent_rf', 'knn', 'ps_perceptron', 'svm', 'ps_svm', 'kappa_mlp', 'tangent_mlp', 'ambient_mlp', 'tangent_gcn', 'ambient_gcn', 'kappa_gcn', 'ambient_mlr', 'tangent_mlr', 'kappa_mlr', 'single_manifold_rf']]) – List of model names to evaluate. Options include: * “sklearn_dt”: Decision tree from scikit-learn. * “sklearn_rf”: Random forest from scikit-learn. * “product_dt”: Product space decision tree. * “product_rf”: Product space random forest. * “tangent_dt”: Decision tree on tangent space. * “tangent_rf”: Random forest on tangent space. * “knn”: k-nearest neighbors. * “ps_perceptron”: Product space perceptron.

  • max_depth (int) – Maximum depth of tree-based models in integer.

  • n_estimators (int) – Integer number of estimators for random forest models.

  • min_samples_split (int) – Minimum number of samples required to split an internal node.

  • min_samples_leaf (int) – Minimum number of samples in a leaf node.

  • task (Literal['classification', 'regression', 'link_prediction']) – Task type (‘classification’ or ‘regression’).

  • seed (Optional[int]) – Random seed for reproducibility.

  • use_special_dims (bool) – Boolean for whether to use special manifold dimensions.

  • n_features (Literal['d', 'd_choose_2']) – Feature dimensionality type (‘d’ or ‘d_choose_2’).

  • X_train (Optional[Float[Tensor, 'n_samples n_manifolds']]) – Training and testing datasets, X: feature, y: label.

  • X_test (Optional[Float[Tensor, 'n_samples n_manifolds']]) – Training and testing datasets, X: feature, y: label.

  • y_train (Optional[Real[Tensor, 'n_samples']]) – Training and testing datasets, X: feature, y: label.

  • y_test (Optional[Real[Tensor, 'n_samples']]) – Training and testing datasets, X: feature, y: label.

  • batch_size (Optional[int]) – Batch size for certain models.

Returns:

Dictionary of model names and their corresponding evaluation scores.

Return type:

Dict[str, float]
